skill.name: diffdock
skill.description: Diffusion-based molecular docking. Predict protein-ligand binding poses from PDB/SMILES, confidence scores, virtual screening, for structure-based drug design. Not for affinity prediction.
skill.summary: Diffusion-based molecular docking. Predict protein-ligand binding poses from PDB/SMILES, confidence ...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill includes local helper scripts that read and write user-specified files for validation and reporting. No network access, credential harvesting, or command execution was found. This is a legitimate scientific tool wrapper.

low_findings.title: Reads and writes user-specified files
low_findings.description: The scripts read local result files and write CSV summaries, for example `with open(confidence_file) as f:` and `with open(output_path, 'w', newline='') as f:`. This is expected for validation and reporting, but it means the skill can access any file path a user provides, which could expose sensitive data if misused.

content.value_statement: You need reliable docking inputs and clear confidence summaries. This skill prepares batch files, checks dependencies, and ranks DiffDock outputs.
actual_capabilities: Check DiffDock environment and dependency status
Create a batch CSV template for protein and ligand inputs
Validate CSV rows, file paths, and SMILES strings
Parse DiffDock result folders and extract confidence scores
Export ranked confidence summaries to CSV
limitations: Does not run DiffDock inference or generate poses
Does not predict binding affinity or kinetics
Requires local DiffDock outputs to analyze
SMILES validation is skipped if RDKit is missing

use_cases.title: Batch input preparation
use_cases.description: Create and validate screening CSV files before running large docking campaigns.

use_cases.title: Environment readiness check
use_cases.description: Verify Python, PyTorch, CUDA, and DiffDock files before pipeline execution.

use_cases.title: Result triage report
use_cases.description: Generate confidence ranked summaries to prioritize poses for inspection.

prompt_templates.title: Check environment
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the setup check and summarize missing dependencies and CUDA status.

prompt_templates.title: Create batch CSV
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a batch CSV template with three example rows and explain each column.

prompt_templates.title: Validate inputs
prompt_templates.scenario: You need to validate a CSV
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate my batch_input.csv and list issues per row with fixes.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze results
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze results in results/batch and export a top 10 confidence summary.

output: Top complex shows confidence 0.82 at rank 1

best_practices: Validate CSV inputs before running large batches
Review several top poses, not only rank 1
Combine confidence scores with visual inspection
anti_patterns: Running batch analysis on empty result folders
Skipping dependency checks on new machines

faq.question: What platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Any system with Python and DiffDock dependencies. GPU support improves speed.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It does not run docking or estimate binding affinity.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into my pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the scripts for CSV preparation and result analysis in automation.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: The scripts read local files you provide and do not send data to external services.

faq.question: What if validation fails?
faq.answer: Fix missing columns, invalid paths, or bad SMILES, then rerun validation.

faq.question: How does it compare to docking engines?
faq.answer: It supports DiffDock workflows, but does not replace docking or scoring engines.
